column4: What would make Dapper not mount flash drives automatically and how can it be fixed?
is your flash drive a USB drive?
yes
do you have a line for it in your /etc/fstab file?
if so, what is it?
I've never added anything, it used to mount them automatically.
in dapper?
yes
It mounts automatically in my other machine and also off the live cd if I boot from that.
try the command gnome-volume-manager
That didn't bring anything up.
now try unplugging and then plugging back in your device
the program is a daemon, so it runs in the background
still nothing
Okay, it just worked in my 3rd usb port.
aha
aha
Thanks door, that's a really useful thing to know if I have that problem in the future.
no problem. Maybe add it to a startup thing for GNOME? It's supposed to start automatically
Oh, would that be under services or should I just add that to startup programs?
I'm really sorry...I don't know--I haven't used GNOME in months. I *think* you can add it in sessions
okay, well thanks again.
